intro: Poa breviglumis, commonly known as the short-glume grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to regions of North America, particularly in the western United States and parts of Canada. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and forest edges. It has slender,丛生 stems and small, spike-like inflorescences with short glumes. The leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green color, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
